section_purpose: To provide a high-level summary of the paper, introducing the problem of solving Weighted MaxSAT with neural networks and presenting HyperSAT as a novel solution using unsupervised hypergraph neural networks.
key_points: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have been promising for SAT and MaxSAT but are underdeveloped for Weighted MaxSAT due to challenges from non-linear dependencies and sensitive objective functions caused by non-uniform clause weights.
HyperSAT is a novel neural approach that uses an unsupervised hypergraph neural network model to solve Weighted MaxSAT problems.

The method involves a hypergraph representation for Weighted MaxSAT instances and a design featuring a cross-attention mechanism and a shared representation constraint loss function to capture logical interactions between positive and negative literal nodes.
Extensive experiments on various datasets demonstrate that HyperSAT achieves better performance than state-of-the-art competitors.
